Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequence number assigned to allow formultiple detail observations.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ANALYSIS PRESSURE: The pressure at which the water analysis was conducted at.
Column Comment.7: ANALYSIS TEMPERATURE: The temperature at which the water analysis wasconducted at.
Column Comment.10: ANALYSIS VALUE: Value for the measurement of the analysis of the property.
Column Comment.11: ANALYSIS VALUE OUOM: Property analysis value original unit of measure (e.g.,mole percentage, BTU, etc.).
Column Comment.12: ANALYSIS VALUE TYPE: The type of value yielded from the water analysis.
Column Comment.13: ANALYSIS VALUE UOM: In cases where the UOM cannot be standardized by use ofthe meta model, the actual unit of measure for the analysis value.
Column Comment.14: ANALYSIS VALUE REMARK: A narrative remark about the analysis of the value.
Column Comment.15: CALCULATED VALUE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not the value inquestion is calculated as opposed to observed.
Column Comment.16: CALCULATION METHOD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the method or formulaused to create a calculated or derived value.
Column Comment.17: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format columns, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.18: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.19: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.20: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum measured or observed value for this property.
Column Comment.23: MEASURED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this value was measured, ratherthan calculated or reported.
Column Comment.24: ANALYSIS MEASUREMENT TYPE: A list of valid measurement types. ANL QCVALID MEASURE lists which measurement types are valid for various types ofanalysis, and what valid ranges for the values should be. In analysis detail tables,ensure that you have selected a measurement type that is appropriate for the type ofstudy.
Column Comment.25: MINIMUM VALUE: the minimum measured or observed value for this property.
Column Comment.28: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.29: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the value in this row ispreferred.
Column Comment.30: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.31: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.32: REPORTED VALUE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the value is asreported by the data provider.
Column Comment.33: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.34: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample.
Column Comment.35: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.36: WATER PROPERTY: Identifies the compositional and/or physical properties beinganalyzed. For example, the types of properties subjected to analysis may be BTU,Gas composition, Mole percentage
Column Comment.37: WATER PROPERTY CODE: the code assigned to the analysis property byobservation, in cases where numeric values are not used.
Column Comment.38: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.40: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.42: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
